title: Victoria Recreation Ground, New Barnet
text:
Victoria Recreation Ground is a public park in <a href="New%20Barnet">New Barnet</a> in the <a href="London%20Borough%20of%20Barnet">London Borough of Barnet</a>, United Kingdom. It is one of Barnet's 'Premier Parks'.
It is mainly grassed with a children's playground, football pitches, tennis and basketball courts, a bowling green and a car park. There are flower beds which are the remains of a formal <a href="flower%20garden">flower garden</a>.
The park is a roughly square area laid out in the late nineteenth century on land previously known as 'Mrs Cook's Farm', and <a href="Barnet%20F.C.">Barnet Football Club</a> played there in the 1889–90 season.
The <a href="Shirebourne%20brook">Shirebourne</a> brook runs along the south side of the park and the <a href="Pymmes%20Brook%20Trail">Pymmes Brook Trail</a> passes north–south through the park.
There is access from Park Road, Victoria Road, Lawton Road, and by a footpath and footbridge from Cromer Road.
